Introduction

Cho Seung Hee (also known as Seunghee), now known as Cho Yihyeon is a South Korean singer and actress. She is a former member of the girl groups F-ve Dolls and DIA. She is now a producer.

In 2013, Seunghee was added as a member of the girl group F-ve Dolls. She officially debuted with them on July 31, 2013, with the release of the digital single "Since 1971". On March 10, 2015, F-ve Dolls officially disbanded.

On September 14 2015, she debuted again, now in the girl group DIA, with the release of the studio album, "Do It Amazing", and its title track "Somehow". On April 30, 2016, it was announced that she would leave both group and agency to pursue her acting career.

In 2019, she became the general producer for PocketDol Studio. On July 15, 2020, it was announced that she changed her stage name to Jo Yi Hyun, and would continue being active in various fields such as dramas and variety shows.

In 2021, she worked on the planning and A&R for the reality survival show My Teenage Girl which formed the girl group CLASS:y. That same year, she established the entertainment company M25 and currently serves as CLASS:y's producer and manager.
